alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 8:23PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: .Very warm temperatures, in the 70s to 80s, in Northern Lynn Canal is causing snow to melt, which is causing rivers to rise. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...The Taiya River near areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail. * WHEN...Until 800 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 812 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from rapid snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Taiya River. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 7:00pm the stage was 16.05 feet. Minor Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: The Taiya River will rise through this evening and crest around 16.5 feet Saturday morning. A secondary rise will occur late Saturday into Sunday. Another crest around 17 feet is expected around 10:00am Sunday. Impacts: At 16.5 feet: Portions of the first few miles of the Chilkoot Trail will begin to inundate with water to ankle depth. At 17.0 feet: The National Park Service advises against boating and other recreational water-based activities on the Taiya River. Trail orientation and navigation begins to become difficult and may hinder route-finding for several hundred feet. Water will be knee deep or higher in places along the lower portions of the trail.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
